Types

Stopwatch = object
  startTime: Option[Time]
  lastLap: Duration

StopwatchAccum = object
  sw: Stopwatch
  laps: seq[Duration]
  total: Duration

Procs

func newStopwatch(): Stopwatch {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
func newStopwatchAccum(): StopwatchAccum {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
func isRunning(sw: var Stopwatch): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if the Stopwatch is measuring time. 
func lastLap(this: Stopwatch): lent Duration {....raises: [], tags: [].}
func laps(this: StopwatchAccum): lent seq[Duration] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc start(this: var Stopwatch) {....raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
Makes the Stopwatch measure time. Will do nothing if the Stopwatch is already doing that. 
proc peek(this: var Stopwatch): Duration {....raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
This will return the length of the current lap (if stop() has not been called) 
proc stop(this: var Stopwatch) {....raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
Makes the Stopwatch stop measuring time. It will record the lap it has taken. If the Stopwatch wasn't running before, nothing will happen 
proc reset(this: var Stopwatch) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Clears out the state of the Stopwatch. 
func total(this: StopwatchAccum): lent Duration {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc totalWithCurrent(this: var StopwatchAccum): Duration {....raises: [],
    tags: [TimeEffect].}
proc stop(this: var StopwatchAccum) {....raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
proc restart(this: var Stopwatch) {....raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
This function will clear out the state of the Stopwatch and tell it to start recording time. It is the same as calling reset() then start(). 
proc init(this: var StopwatchAccum) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Clears out the state of the Stopwatch. This deletes all of the lap data. 
func numRanLaps(this: var StopwatchAccum): int {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the number of laps the Stopwatch has recorded so far. 
func numRunningLaps(this: var StopwatchAccum): int {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the number of laps the Stopwatch has recorded so far. It will include the current lap in the count. 
proc erasureLapAt(this: var StopwatchAccum; idx: int) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Removes a lap from the Stopwatch's record with the given index of num. This function has the possibility of raising an IndexError. 
proc clearLaps(this: var StopwatchAccum) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
This clears out all of the lap records from a Stopwatch. This will not effect the current lap (if one is being measured).

Converters

converter sw(this: StopwatchAccum): lent Stopwatch {....raises: [], tags: [].}
converter sw(this: var StopwatchAccum): var Stopwatch {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Templates

template bench(this: var Stopwatch; body: untyped): untyped
A simple template that will wrap the start() and stop() calls around a block of code. Make sure that the passed in Stopwatch has been initialized. Even if the Stopwatch is already running, it won't stop the Stopwatch. 
template bench(this: var StopwatchAccum; body: untyped): untyped
A simple template that will wrap the start() and stop() calls around a block of code. Make sure that the passed in Stopwatch has been initialized. Even if the Stopwatch is already running, it won't stop the Stopwatch.
